predict_diagnosis:
1. Sickle cell disease
2. Hemophilia
3. Hemolytic uremic syndrome
4. Disseminated intravascular coagulation
5. Hemoglobinuria
6. Acute myeloid leukemia
7. Acute lymphoblastic leukemia
8. Hodgkin lymphoma
9. Non-Hodgkin lymphoma
10. Felty syndrome

These are some of the most common and serious genetic and acquired diseases that can present with these symptoms. Further investigation into the patient history, physical examination, and laboratory findings will be required to confirm the specific diagnosis. It's important to note that the order of the diagnoses is arbitrary and there may be other less common, but equally important possibilities.
